page.title: 05THE M4 MOTORWAY
page.content: In December 1971 the section of the M4 at Chieveley was completed and opened to traffic. This meant you could travel all the way from London to Wales (140 miles) in two or three hours. It had taken 10 years to build. People living nearby had been worried about things like the Berkshire countryside being spoilt by the road. The farmers were worried that their cattle would stray onto the road and be killed, and the land owners were worried that the roots of the trees near the road would become loose and the trees would fall down. Because of the motorway many more people could live in our area and work in London, and the farms got more machinery so less people were needed to work there. Today the verges of motorways are becoming important nature reserves for wild flowers and animals.
